intro: Lacis schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiedea lacis, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant is shrub-like, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the Hawaiian Islands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
